poem:
Title: The Crumbling of Peace

"Run!" cries the Airbus man,
Trump or Russia may seize our land.
Iron wings of war could command
the day's gentle hand.

Yet morning breaks,
tussle in the east a half-aware dream.
Bread in toaster, a dog's acute whine.
Life, lest felled by a leader's whim,
Continues. Amen.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Airbus boss warns of threat to Europe from Russia and Trump Europe is unprepared for war with Russia or the risk that Donald Trump could withdraw the US from Nato and needs to ramp up spending on defence equipment, the boss of Airbus has said. Guillaume Faury, the chief executive of Europe’s biggest aerospace and defence company, said it was a “defining moment” for the continent’s defence industry, after Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
